channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Watch: Dubai YouTuber Mo Vlogs' suffers severe allergic reaction, seeks help
item.description: Dubai's top YouTuber Mo Vlogs sought the help of social media in treating some bad allergic reaction following which his face has become unrecognizable. "All the muscles of my face have contracted," the YouTuber said announcing that he was going to the hospital. He said his body was swelling up and he did not know why these crazy things were happening.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Donald Trump has presumptive immunity for official acts: Supreme Court
item.description: "Big win for our constitution and democracy. Proud to be an American," Donald Trump posted on Truth Social as his first reaction after the verdict. For Trump camp, the verdict is a relief because he is now unlikely to face any trial before the November 5 election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indian-origin woman dies on plane before take-off in Australia: 'She was struggling with seat-belt'
item.description: ​Manpreet Kaur moved to Australia in March 2020. This was the first time that she was going to visit her family in Delhi. A Qantas spokesperson said flight crew and emergency services both provided emergency medical assistance. Kaur's friend Gurdip Grewal said Manpreet had been feeling unwell in the hours before she arrived at the airport. "When she got on the plane, she was struggling to put her seatbelt on," the friend said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Obama privately telling people Biden can't win: Tucker Carlson
item.description: Barack Obama called Joe Biden's debate disaster a bad night as he put out a supportive statement defending Joe Biden as the Democrats were tearing into the President. "Bad debate nights happen. Trust me, I know. But this election is still a choice between someone who has fought for ordinary forks his entire life and someone who only cares about himself," Barack Obama wrote. But this is posturing, in private Obama is telling people Biden can't win, former Fox News host Tucker Carlson posted on X.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Not Biden, his top advisers should be fired: What family discussed at Camp David
item.description: Joe Biden opting out of the race is not a possibility now after the Biden family get-together at Camp David Sunday. Biden family members were unanimous in supporting Joe Biden that he should keep fighting. Instead, the role of the advisers wh0 allowed Biden to face Trump in the debate knowing what they must have known is under scrutiny.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: '90 minutes do not define four years of Joe Biden': First Lady's message loud and clear
item.description: ​Jill Biden, popularly called as Dr Biden, is under a lot of heat now as Democrat donors are blaming Dr Biden for not asking him to step aside. Billionaire Bill Ackman squarely blamed Dr Biden for dragging Joe Biden into the race for her own interest of being treated like a queen. While the Camp David family meet was supposed to be a brainstorming session on whether Biden should step aside from the race, Jill Biden gave her message loud and clear: She won't give up.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan's Karachi reels under hottest period since 2015
item.description: "With 39.2°C on Sunday, feels like the temperature surges to 55°C at 5 pm. The current weather conditions were the hottest since the 2015 heatwave during which the maximum temperature," Sarfaraz said.

item.title: 19 inmates flee from Pakistan-occupied Kashmir prison, 1 dead
item.description: Following the Rawalkot prison break, an inquiry committee is established. PM Chaudhry Anwarul Haq takes action against involved officials, suspending some and reassigning others. The incident leads to heightened security measures and search operations in the region.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China deploys aircraft carrier off Philippine coast amid tensions over South China Sea
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 7 people, including 4 kids shot in Nebraska; suspect tells them to 'go back where they came from'
item.description: Nebraska State Patrol revealed in a press conference that the gunman, Billy Booth, fired multiple shots at victims of different ages, causing injuries. The shooting occurred in Crete, with most victims targeted while outside the house. Booth's actions led to injuries to several individuals, including children, in the tragic incident.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Sri Lankan politician Sampanthan passes away
Australia appoints second woman governor-general in 123 years to represent King Charles III
item.dc:creator: TOI News Desk

item.title: Handover day: China gifts a pair of giant pandas to Hong Kong
item.description: Hong Kong's city leader, John Lee, announced that China will gift giant pandas to commemorate the 27th anniversary of Hong Kong's return to Chinese control. This gesture symbolizes China's support for the city. Lee highlighted the positive impact of security laws on stability and property market growth, with a GDP target of 2.5% to 3.5% this year.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK general election: Main contenders, key issues; All you need to know
item.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has called for an early general election on July 4, raising the stakes for the Conservative party's 14-year rule. This election could see the end of their governance, potentially ushering in a centre-left Labour government under Keir Starmer. Despite positive economic news, opinion polls favour Labour, highlighting public dissatisfaction with the Conservatives.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'No longer has mental acuity': Billionaire Bill Ackman shifts blame from Biden to First Lady
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Increase in juvenile crimes: The shocking way China is reacting to brutal murders of little girls
item.description: China is facing a surge in violent crimes committed by juveniles, including horrific murders of young girls by boys as young as 12. The country's lenient approach to juvenile offenders, often sending them to mental institutions or allowing them to return to school shortly after the crimes, is under scrutiny.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australia foreign student visa policy changes: Fees doubled, extension gets difficult
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Extremely dangerous' Hurricane Beryl nears Caribbean, becomes earliest category 4 storm on record
